author: Jacob Bermateo
comment: One hickup though, after letting this run for a while, my screen was all screwed up with it flickering a bunch, fixxed by resetting watch and turning it off for a while. but it did fix my dead pixels. my experience was a few black pixels in a line. now they're gone after a few hours of letting it run on (.05 seconds i think)
title: worked like a charm

author: Michael Garcia
comment: Works as advertised! The Moto 360 (1st Generation) is susceptible to screen burn-ins. Doing this fixed it!  Cons: No donation button?

author: Joel Smith
comment: When my Moto 360 would boot, I thought I saw two dead pixels on the boot logo.  Sure enough, this app confirmed it.  Time for an exchange.  Thank you for this app!
title: Confirmed my suspicions

author: Lennard de Rijk
comment: Managed to find a dead pixel, it didn't get unstuck though :(, so time to go for an exchange. This app is great at finding them though.
title: Works like a charm

author: Rob Cooper
comment: I really wanted the test pattern in the app picture. As it is it works perfectly and as advertised although I don't have any stuck pixels. Given all that I should have given 4 stars instead of one.
title: Darn I wanted the test pattern

author: Gijs Prevo
comment: Helped me to fix two stuck pixels on my 360.
title: Does what it is made for!

author: AX48D
comment: Fixed mine :D But there's still a little dot left
App won't let me change speed or colors

author: andreas moller
comment: i am unable to open the app on my lg g watch R running wear 2.0

author: Darius Glemza
comment: Identified the dead pixels but did not fix.  Nice and easy interface with good ad placement

author: Artem Gusselnikov
comment: It's really work for my Moto 360 1gen, 5 stars! Thanks, guys!

author: Lex Leonard
comment: This does work but you need to give it hours

author: Marco Chapita
comment: Don't show up on my watch

author: Haochen Tong
comment: 5 stars because of title. Unfortunately did not fix those stucked pixels for me, probably because they are physically dead. Still a good app, and thanks for your effort.
title: Compensating for others stupidity

author: Daniel Thursfield
comment: Might not be intended use,  but I use it now and again when I see slight burn in on my LG G Watch R screen.  Gets ride of the issue :)
title: Great little app!

comment: Tapping on my asus two watchface does nothing. Why can't this be accessed another way.. Like add to wear app and pushed to the watch.. Am i missing this feature because i looked everywhere for another way

author: Joel Chavarria
comment: It damaged even more my moto360 screen, now it has more dead pixels
title: Don't download!!!

author: Jorge Cereijo-Perez
comment: Tried installing twice and hitting sync in wear app but the app never appears on the watch menu.
title: App won't sync to my moto360

author: Matthew Sousa
comment: Shows if you have a dead pixel but did not fix it
title: No fix

author: THE GARRISON
comment: Please make it avaliable for Sony smartwatch 2
